original_prompt:
I want to pull multiple repositories from github into this folder to build a monorepo:

drseanwing/foam
drseanwing/researchplanner
drseanwing/ralphgh
drseanwing/critlit

They all share a common architecture and infrastructure.

So, using ralph ulw, bring in these four repositories in subdirectories, and perform a comprehensive analysis of all four code-bases, identifying common architecture which can be extracted to a core "pipeline orchestrator" module. COnsider the ramifications of such a retooling and identify potential risks and errors which need to be handled.

Develop a granular implementation plan for the mono-repo version of this application including planning, building, validating, CI tests, code review checkpoints and quality gates, documentation and deployment (in a docker rootless environment, with a tight range of external ports exposed between 5810 and 5850).

Commit atomically.
